Dispute_Type: Visa refusal under skilled worker class
Legal_Issue: Breach of procedural fairness by visa officer
Governing_Law: Immigration and Refugee Protection Regulations (IRPR) subsection 75(3)
Evidence_Assessment: Applicant's job duties matched NOC 1431; promotion occurred after application period
Burden_of_Proof: On applicant to demonstrate eligibility and procedural breach
Legal_Rule: Visa officers must follow procedural fairness but may refuse applications if requirements are unmet
Procedural_Issue: Whether decision was made before deadline for additional documents
Procedural_Fairness_Assessment: No breach occurred as additional documents would not have changed outcome
Key_Evidence_Considered: Job duties, NOC code classification, timing of promotion
Legal_Framework: Immigration and Refugee Protection Act (IRPA) and IRPR
Applicant_Challenge: Decision made prematurely without considering potential additional documents
Defendant_Response: Decision was lawful and within regulatory authority
Grounds_for_Inadmissibility_or_Allegatio: Failure to meet skill level requirement (O, A, or B); promotion after application period
